channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Six new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, one more death
item.description: Six new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in the past 24 hours in New Zealand, with one more death confirmed.

item.title: Covid-19: Live updates from New Zealand and around the world on 22 April
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says there is no end point yet to the mandatory quarantine rules. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest news.

item.title: Bubble-bound: Data shows most people obeying rules
item.description: Global data collected by Google shows most New Zealanders are continuing to abide by level 4 restrictions, despite an increase in lockdown breaches and convictions.

item.title: Dunedin's Royal Albatross family: Waiting for a father's return
item.description: The Royal Albatross family on Dunedin's Tairoa Head, watched by more than 180,000 people around the world, has been reunited after an anxious month.

item.title: Queenstown renters struggling to survive in lockdown
item.description: Queenstown is facing a new wave of rental challenges as some tenants face high rents with limited to no income.

item.title: 'PPE breach' blamed for Christchurch healthcare workers catching Covid-19
item.description: Canterbury District Health Board says damp and unchanged personal protective equipment was likely to blame for three of its healthcare workers getting Covid-19.

item.title: Some cancer screenings to resume under level 3
item.description: Screening for some cancers can resume under a level 3 lockdown, but others will remain on pause, the Cancer Control Agency said.

item.title: Join RNZ to commemorate Anzac Day from your bubble
item.description: This year you can commemorate Anzac Day at home from your bubble with RNZ's #StandAtDawn service on air and online.

item.title: Post mortem underway after body found in Clutha River
item.description: A post mortem is being conducted in next few days on the body of a man found in the Clutha River yesterday afternoon.

item.title: Man who murdered sex worker appeals sentence
item.description: A man who murdered a Christchurch sex worker is appealing his sentence.

item.title: Covid-19: Reusable masks to add extra layer of protection for workers
item.description: New Zealand researchers have designed a reusable face shield for medical staff to wear while treating Covid-19 positive patients.

item.title: SkyCity International Convention Centre fire was accidental - report
item.description: The fire that burned for three days last year at the SkyCity International Convention Centre has been found to be accidental.

item.title: Three face meth charges after raids on two properties
item.description: Three people have been charged after police found what appears to be a methamphetamine lab in West Auckland.

item.title: RNZ wins seven medals at New York Festivals Radio Awards
item.description: RNZ has seven medallists in the New York Festivals Radio Awards: two gold, two silver, three bronze, and four finalists.

item.title: David Tamihere: 'All I wanted was a fair hearing'
item.description: Convicted double murderer David Tamihere wants a retrial after he was granted a rare Royal Prerogative of Mercy.

item.title: Missing Auckland teen found
item.description: A 17 year old who went missing earlier this week from Ōtāhuhu has now been found.

item.title: Almost 4000 people breached Covid-19 lockdown - police
item.description: Police say nearly 4000 people have breached the lockdown restrictions, many in the days before the PM announced the change next week to alert level 3.

item.title: 'It's Christmas on steroids' - foodbanks in huge demand across NZ
item.description: After four weeks in lockdown, food banks around the country say there has been a dramatic rise in the number of people needing help to put food on the table.
